titlestmt.titleproper: Rhode Island Conference of the United Church of Christ records, 1812-2019.
titlestmt.author: Zachary Bodnar

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday October 2, 2025 at 14:45

did.unittitle: Rhode Island Conference of the United Church of Christ records, 1812-2019.
did.abstract: The Rhode Island Domestic Missionary Society was formed in 1802 and the Evangelical Consociation of Congregational Churches was formed in 1806. The two entities merged in 1912 as the Rhode Island Congregational Conference. The Rhode Island Congregational Conference merged with the Rhode Island and Massachusetts Christian Conference in 1931 to form the Rhode Island Congregational Christian Conference. After the formation of the United Church of Christ, the conference was known as the Rhode Island Conference of the United Church of Christ. In 2020, the Rhode Island, Connecticut, and Massachusetts Conferences merged to form the Southern New England Conference of the United Church of Christ. This collection contains the records of the Rhode Island Conference of the United Church of Christ and its predecessor organization and includes meeting minutes, board records, reports, programs and brochures, newsletters, communications, and legal records.

corpname.part: United Church of Christ. Rhode Island Conference
Evangelical Consociation of Congregational Churches in Rhode Island
Rhode Island and Connecticut Christian Conference
Rhode Island and Massachusetts Christian Conference.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is unrestricted and open to the public.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Items in this collection are subject to U.S. Copyright Law. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine the copyright status of collection items and to secure any permissions necessary for their reproduction and publication. Requests for permission to publish material must be discussed with the archivist or librarian.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Rhode Island Conference of the United Church of Christ records, 1812-2019, RG0150. The Congregational Library & Archives, Boston, MA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials were donated to the Congregational Library & Archives by the Historic Rhode Island Conference of the United Church of Christ in the 1970s, 1984, and February 2025; only the 2025 accrual has an accession number: 2025-04.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was minimally processed by staff of the Congregational Library & Archives in 1984 and 1997. The collection was reprocessed by Katie Rice in March 2016. Following a massive accrual in 2025, the collection was reprocessed completely by Zachary Bodnar in September 2025 according to the rules of Describing Archives: A Content Standard.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The organization of Congregationalists into a single statewide entity in Rhode Island began in 1802 with the formation of the Rhode Island Domestic Missionary Society. This group was closely followed up with the formation of the Evangelical Consociation of Congregational Churches in 1806. The first of these two groups became the Rhode Island Home Missionary Society in 1849 and became a centralized administrative group focused on the needs of Congregationalists within Rhode Island. The later of the two groups, which had a few names, but most prominently settled on the Rhode Island Congregational Conference, was initially formed to promote fellowship and communication between the ordained Congregational clergy of Rhode Island. The two organizations formally united as a single entity in 1912 while retaining the name Rhode Island Congregational Conference.

The Christians in Rhode Island largely belonged to one of two different conferences throughout the 19th century. The Connecticut Christian Conference was formed in 1821 and then in 1834 became the Rhode Island and Connecticut Christian Conference. The Rhode Island and Massachusetts Christian Conference, formed in 1837, separated from the Massachusetts Christian Conference to form an explicitly anti-slavery Christian Conference. The Rhode Island and Connecticut Christian Conference merged into the Rhode Island and Massachusetts Christian Conference in 1875. When the national Congregational and Christian organizations merged together in 1931, the Rhode Island and Massachusetts Christian Conference merged with the Rhode Island Congregational Conference to form the Rhode Island Congregational Christian Conference.

After the formation of the United Church of Christ in 1957, the Rhode Island Congregational Christian Conference became known as the Rhode Island Congregational Conference (United Church of Christ) after the Constitution was amended in 1963. Eventually, the name would become the Rhode Island Conference of the United Church of Christ.

A proposal for the Rhode Island, Connecticut, and Massachusetts Conferences of the United Church of Christ to merge was initially submitted in 2016. On January 1, 2020, the Southern New England Conference of the United Church of Christ was formed out of the merger of those three statewide conferences. Offices for the Historic Rhode Island Conference were subsequently closed and by 2025 the papers and records of the conference were appropriately disbursed to various organizations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains the records of the Rhode Island Conference of the United Church of Christ. The collection is primarily administrative in nature and includes records, minutes, reports, financial records, board records, annual reports, and correspondence that speak to the day-to-day running of the conference. The collection also contains records of predecessor organizations, most prominently, the Rhode Island and Massachusetts Christian Conference, the Rhode Island and Connecticut Christian Conference, and the Rhode Island Home Missionary Society. The collection also contains records related to the programs, task forces, and committees that the conference promoted and supported throughout its history. A sizable portion of the collection are communications and legal records related to individual Congregational and Christian churches within Rhode Island and their ministers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials in this collection have been arranged into the four series listed below. The Conference records series has been further divided into seven topical subseries to support the accessibility of the materials. Materials within most series and subseries have been further arranged into chronological order by start date. Materials within the Church communications and records series and the Conference programs and task forces series have been arranged according to chronological order to mimic how these materials were originally filed, or intended to be filed, by the original record keepers.
Series 4: Conference programs and task forces, 1930-2017

phystech.head: Technical Requirements
phystech.p: This collection contains both compact disks and floppy disks. Information on floppy discs cannot be retrieved and are unavailable to researchers. Researchers may access information from compact disks with the help and permission of a CLA staff member.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Rhode Island Congregational Christian Conference Records, 1803-1973, MSS 140. Rhode Island Historical Society.

subject.part: Social justice -- Religious aspects -- United Church of Christ.

Rhode Island and Massachusetts Christian Conference.
United Church of Christ. Southern New England Conference
United Church of Christ. Rhode Island Conference

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records relating to various Congregational Churches in Rhode Island. The majority of the records are either direct communications between the conference and the individual churches and/or records related to church properties. Another large portion of the records are related to the hiring of ministers and the completion of church profiles as part of the hiring process. The series also contains various records and documents the churches sent to the conference over the course of their histories.

did.unittitle: Oversized photographic prints of Rhode Island churches

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records relating to the Rhode Island and Massachusetts Christian Conference and the Rhode Island and Connecticut Christian Conference. The series largely contains administrative records from the two conferences, with the bulk of the series being meeting minutes. A sizable portion of the series is also correspondence files. The series also contains newsletters, bulletins, certificates, financial records, and certificates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to the administration and functions of the Rhode Island Conference of the United Church of Christ, as well as its predecessor and subordinate organizations. The series includes conference histories, ministerial correspondence, legal and financial records, governance documents, meeting minutes, board reports, annual reports, and conference planning records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains financial records for the conference as well as organizations under the conference. The subseries contains ledgers, fund books, documents related to trusts and bequests, investment related records, financial statements, and other various types of financial records.

did.unittitle: Rhode Island Home Missionary Society treasurer's books
Rhode Island Home Missionary Society ledger
Woman's Board of Missions named funds
List of holdings from the Rhode Island Congregational Conference to the Rhode Island Hopsital Trust Co agency account

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains legal records related to the conference. Much of the subseries contains deeds and other property related documents. The subseries also contains legal documents related to the government, legal agreements, and other various legal documents.

did.unittitle: Edith M. May papers and agreement
Samuel Clarke Fund superior court decree

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records related to the administration of the conference. The subseries contains records related to the organizations and structure of conference, such as constitutions, bylaws, and records related to potential and realized restructurings. The series also contains records and minutes related to organizations established under the conference, such as the Rhode Island Home Missionary Society, the Congregational Brotherhood of Rhode Island, and the Rhode Island Women's Fellowship. This subseries also contains records related to the formation of the Southern New England Conference, the successor to the Rhode Island Conference. The subseries includes meeting minutes, governance documents, planning document, and photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains correspondence and other records related to ministers within the conference.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains records from the board of directors of the conference. The majority of the records are board reports and minutes, but the subseries also contains correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains documents and manuscripts related to the history of the conference. The subseries contains three different versions of a 1970 conference history written by James H. Lightbourne.

did.unittitle: Church histories gathered for 150th conference anniversary
History of the Rhode Island Conference manuscript

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains both annual reports for the conference as well as the records of the conference's annual and autumnal meetings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the programmatic records of the Rhode Island Conference. The majority of the records in the series relate to either programs and events sponsored and/or run by the conference and its staff or to task forces convened by the conference. These programmatic records describe in detail the wide variety of activities the conference sponsored throughout its history, especially during the 20th century. The records also show a growing interest in social justice issues throughout the century. The records include meeting minutes and communications from task forces, brochures and programs, event flyers, newsletters, and correspondence.
